generated.title: GeneratedSpecificSurfaceArea
generated.description: This is an autogenerated partial class definition of 'SpecificSurfaceArea'

description*.en: Specific surface area (SSA) is a property of solids defined as the total surface area (SA) of a material per unit mass, (with units of m²/kg or m²/g). It is a physical value that can be used to determine the type and properties of a material (e.g. soil or snow). It has a particular importance for adsorption, heterogeneous catalysis, and reactions on surfaces.
